result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas W Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
VIP Program for 9 months
Conditions:
Attend Groups or day reports at discretion of VIP case manager
Complete AODA assessments and comply with any treatment recommendation
Sign any necessary releases of information
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Participate in other community based services as determined by VIP program director

timeConds.notes: 20 hrs community service, preferrably with Po Co Parks Dept

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today with the Clerk of Court's Office.
*Provide a DNA sample, if not already done so

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas W Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Douglas W Johnson
Current: 2501 Forest Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 09-28-2017)
Prior: N11271 County Road P, Iola, WI 54945
Reminder Notice
DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Douglas W Johnson in court. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:08 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant appears without counsel.
Matter was adjourned to today to get counsel.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant wishes to proceed without a lawyer.

Court questions Defendant on his waiver of counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant has freely and voluntarily waiving his right to counsel.

Court reviews the file.

Defendant previously entered a plea, was in the VIP program, but Defendant failed the program.

Atty Hess addresses the Court, states recommendations.

Defendant addresses the Court.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $150 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Submit to DNA Sample if not already done so
Get on a payment plan before leaving

20 days in which to appeal the case.
Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Douglas W Johnson in court. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  VIP Program director, Mike Champion appears in person.

4:02 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Hess states the appearances.
This is a motion hearing to terminate the defendant's VIP.
Atty Hess makes statements. 
Court questions the defendant; defendant responds.
Court makes statements to the defendant as to what he failed to provide to the VIP Program.
Court questions M Champion; M Champion responds.
Defendant makes additional statements.

BY THE COURT:
VIP is terminated.
Sentencing date to be set.
Parties to meet with the Br 3 JA and get a date set.
Motion hearing on August 29, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Douglas W Johnson in court. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:34 PM Court calls case.
Atty Zell states appearances.

Matter is on the calendar for a hearing on motion to terminate the VIP program.
State has an affidavit from Mr. Champion.

Court addresses the parties.
Defendant was here a year ago, pro se, entered a plea to the charge. Court did not enter acceptance of guilty but ordered VIP program with conditions.

Defendant remembers being in Court on that date, remembers waiving right to counsel. 
Case Manager indicates that Defendant missed first meeting with assigned mentor, failed to return phone calls and failed to attend meetings and failed to make changes of address. Defendant admitted to drug use in February and April.  

Defendant addresses the Court, states the Case Manager was confused as to why the referral was getting denied. Defendant would like Mr. Champion present.

Defendant addresses the Court.

Court questions Defendant for clarifications.

Court informs Defendant of right to counsel.
Defendant would like a lawyer.

Defendant works at Superior Roofing.

Address is verified.

Discussions continue among parties.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 29, 2017 at 03:15 pm.
Motion hearing on June 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
to Terminate VIP
Motion hearing on July 7, 2017 at 09:30 am.
VIP extended 06-26-17.
VIP Program Assessment and Recommendations

Defendant Douglas W Johnson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:29 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable has just arrived.

Atty Constable states the plea agreement.

Defendant concurs.

Court questions Defendant regarding right to counsel/public defender's office.
Court finds Defendant's waiver of counsel is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. 

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney Constable  stipulates that there is factual basis for the charge, no further facts to present.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court does NOT find the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to NOT enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Defendant addresses the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
VIP Program for 9 months
Conditions:
20 hrs community service, preferrably with Po Co Parks Dept
Attend Groups or day reports at discretion of VIP case manager
Complete AODA assessments and comply with any treatment recommendation
Sign any necessary releases of information
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Participate in other community based services as determined by VIP program director
VIP Program Assessment and Recommendations
Plea hearing on June 27, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

2:02 p.m. Defendant Douglas W Johnson appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has not received the copy of the complaint.
Court will set aside to allow complaint be sent to the jail.
2:22 p.m. Court back in session for this case. Defendant has reviewed the criminal complaint and waives reading of it by the Court.
Court informs Defendant of his rights and right to counsel.
Court questions the Defendant.
Court orders Defendant to contact the Public Defender's office. If not eligible, Defendant may petition the Court for Indigency Hearing to see if Court will appoint an attorney.
Court finds probable cause from the Criminal Complaint.
Court enters P/NG.
State requests a $500 sig bond.
Court sets bond.
Defendant states he is on a PO hold.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
